description: From Latin diagnōsis, from Ancient Greek διάγνωσις (diágnōsis), from διαγιγνώσκω (diagignṓskō, “to discern”), from διά (diá, “through”) + γιγνώσκω (gignṓskō, “to know”).

entries.meaning: (medicine) The identification of the nature and cause of an illness.
examples: He was given the wrong treatment due to an erroneous diagnosis.

entries.meaning: The identification of the nature and cause of something (of any nature).
examples: The quick eye for effects, the clear diagnosis of men's minds, and the love of epigram.

entries.meaning: (taxonomy) A written description of a species or other taxon serving to distinguish that species from all others; especially a description written and published in Latin.

examples: Experienced mechanics can diagnosis the condition of machinery just by listening.
